00036 //  START OF SMViewLinking.h
00037 
00038 //  protocol that views can adopt to maintain their layout as it was defined in IB.
00039 //  one view (source view) can 'link' one of its four graphical borders (= fix the distance) to those of other
00040 //  views (destination views), and those destination views will be moved/resized if the
00041 //  source view changes.
00042 //  if the destination views are source views themselves, the linked destiantion views
00043 //  resize, too. this of course, is the big weakness of this system, because...:
00044 //
00045 //  WARNING: you have to avoid 'linkining feedbacks' where subviews are stiffly linked
00046 //  with their superviews in a closed loop. this conflicts with the standard autoresizing!
00047 
00048

00090 // helper function
00091 float SMViewLinkingBorderPosition(NSRect frame,  
00092                                                                   SMViewLinkingBorderType border)
00093 {
00094         if (border == SMViewLinkingTopBorderType) {return (frame.origin.y +  
00095                                                                                                            frame.size.height);}
00096         if (border == SMViewLinkingBottomBorderType) {return (frame.origin.y);}
00097         if (border == SMViewLinkingLeftBorderType) {return (frame.origin.x);}
00098         if (border == SMViewLinkingRightBorderType) {return (frame.origin.x  
00099                                                                                                                  + frame.size.width);}
00100         return 0.0;
00101 }
